image.altText: Man in suit talking.

props.synopsis: Minister Papalia walked back the comments about conditions in detention during question time in parliament on Wednesday.

title.children: Minister corrects comments on youth detention after WA Children's Court president speaks out

image.altText: A tight head and shoulders shot of a man smiling and wearing sunglasses with a beach behind him.

props.synopsis: A Perth civil engineer accused of drugging and filming himself sexually assaulting more than dozen women says he made one recording to "tease" one of his alleged victims for being "lazy".

title.children: Alleged rapist tells court he made video recording of sexual act to 'tease' alleged victim

image.altText: A man in a black shirt walking out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: The 44-year-old man originally appeared in court charged with unlawful killing over the 2022 death, but this was downgraded to a lesser charge.

title.children: Broome man who ran over his partner while drunk found guilty of dangerous driving causing death

image.altText: Bald man with face tattoos stares at camera with arms crossed.

props.synopsis: Matt Darcy nearly died of a heroin overdose. As drug-induced deaths rise in Western Australia, health services are pushing to get naloxone into more hands.

title.children: Medication can save someone's life during an overdose, but not everyone can access it

image.altText: A child smiles while holding up a brightly decorated banner.

props.synopsis: Children from across an area the size of the UK have gathered in WA's remote, red heartland for the annual Dust Up festival. Â

title.children: Culture and languages unite in red heartland to motivate kids to engage with school

image.altText: An aerial shot of coastline with a long wharf extending out.

props.synopsis: The nation's largest solar salt project has marked a major milestone in what has been a challenging road through planning stages.Â

title.children: Australia's largest salt project wins government approval in WA's north

image.altText: Two adults and two children stand together in front of a suspension bridge with a river in the background.

props.synopsis: With coastal property prices experiencing "supercharged growth", people wanting a tree change are turning their attention to Northam in WA's Wheatbelt.

title.children: Tree change, acreage, and community attract city-based millennials to Northam

image.altText: A mining truck carrying iron ore on a remote mine site.

props.synopsis: Critics say the $430 fee will lead to fewer people challenging permits for mining activities.

title.children: 'Anti-democratic': Opponents slam WA government fee for opposing mining activities

image.altText: A side by side image of Donald Trump looking angry and yelling and Kamala Harris smirking and raising her eyebrows

props.synopsis: In the last debate of this election, Joe Biden saw his 2024 ambitions evaporate. This time, his deputy Kamala Harris went in determined to ruffle Donald Trump's feathers. These were the big moments.

title.children: The big moments from the fiery Trump-Harris debate â including a surprise announcement from Taylor Swift

image.altText: Police in riot gear stand behind officres pushing back crowds of protesters in the middle of a street.

props.synopsis: Protesters have punched horses and pelted officers with rocks, cans of baked beans, horse manure and acid, says the chief commissioner. Meanwhile, police have been accused of using excessive force.

title.children: Victoria Police maintain presence at Land Forces expo as human rights groups condemn 'excessive' force

image.altText: Michelle Rowland stands in a Parliament House courtyard wearing red.

props.synopsis: Proposed laws set to be introduced to parliament on Thursday would grant Australia's media watchdog greater powers to force tech companies to crack down on misinformation and disinformation.

title.children: Social media companies could be fined for not cracking down on misinformation under new bill

image.altText: A collage of three musicians

props.synopsis: Fortnight is nominated in nine different categories at the MTV Video Music Awards, while Olivia Rodrigo, Chappell Roan, Charli XCX, Eminem and *NSYNC are also up for awards.

title.children: See the MTV VMA nominees, from Taylor Swift & Post Malone to [checks notes] Taylor Swift & Post Malone

image.altText: Two men wearing suits conversing next to a train

props.synopsis: The US and UK's chief foreign affairs advisors visit Ukraine to discuss the country's military needs in its fight against Russia.

title.children: Top US, UK diplomats make rare joint visit to Kyiv as Ukraine appeals for right to fire long-range missiles into Russia

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: Walter Sofronoff told a News Corp editor that the ACT's former director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold "wrought evil" and was "eager to lie to jail a man who may be innocent," court documents have revealed.

title.children: 'This is insanity': Court documents reveal texts and emails between Lehrmann inquiry chair and News Corp journalists

image.altText: an upset woman cries out the front of a courthouse

props.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button was behind the wheel of a bus returning from a wedding when it flipped on a roundabout, killing 10 passengers and injuring 25 others.

title.children: Families surprised by bus driver's 32-year sentence for killing their loved ones

image.altText: A womanan uses her phone as she passes a large and illuminated Apple logo

props.synopsis: A tax deal worth billions between Ireland and the maker of iPhones was upheld as illegal by an EU court, meaning an accounting exercise worth $21 billion.

title.children: How Apple paid less than 1 per cent tax in Ireland â and ended up owing billions

image.altText: AyÅenur Ezgi Eygi wears a graduation cap and a keffiyeh and holds a bunch of pink flowers while standing on a roadside.

props.synopsis: AyÅenur Ezgi Eygi's family called for an independent investigation into her death after the Israel Defense Forces released its preliminary findings.

title.children: Biden seeks 'full accountability' from Israel over shooting of American activist in West Bank

image.altText: Two paramedics wheel stretcher beds to an ambulance on a dark street.

props.synopsis: Two of three children who were rescued from a burning home in Melbourne's north-west earlier this week have died in hospital.

title.children: Two children have died days after rescue from house fire in Melbourne's north-west

image.altText: A man in a bright orange hazmat suit stand next to a piece of machinery unloading chemicals.

props.synopsis: Australia's leading advocate on Parkinson's disease is calling for a ban on a widely-used chemical because of growing evidence about the risk to farmers.

title.children: Parkinson's Australia calls for ban on widely-used chemical paraquat over risk to farmers

image.altText: A bald man in a Hawaiian shirt standing in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: The Queensland opposition promises it would launch an independent "systems" inquiry into Ashley Paul Griffith, who last week pleaded guilty to more than 300 offences against children.Â

title.children: Qld LNP vows to launch inquiry into one of the nation's worst paedophiles if it wins state election

image.altText: Tyrese Haspil in a white jumpsuit and blue face mask, surrounded by five men in suits.

props.synopsis: A personal assistant convicted of killing and dismembering his former tech entrepreneur boss after stealing about $US400,000 from him is sentenced to 40 years to life.

title.children: Personal assistant convicted of killing tech entrepreneur Fahim Saleh sentenced to 40 years to life

image.altText: A composite image of Emma Germano and a man in a suit pouring chemical.

props.synopsis: This farmer chose to speak up as peak lobby group closes ranks in the wake of investigations exposing Parkinson's link to chemical.

title.children: Leaked email reveals farming lobby's attempt to silence discussion about Parkinson's link to farming chemical

image.altText: Eight people wearing high-vis gear stand outside a plane.

props.synopsis: Two Delta Air Lines planes collide on a taxiway at Atlanta's airport, with a larger plane knocking off the tail section of a smaller regional jet.

title.children: Tail section knocked off Delta plane during collision at US airport

image.altText: A beluga whale being fed fish from a boat.

props.synopsis: Hvaldimir, who rose to fame in 2019 for his friendly antics, was found dead on August 31 by fishermen who dragged his body ashore to Risavika Port.Â

title.children: No indication that Russian 'spy whale' Hvaldimir was shot in Norway, local police say

image.altText: Danielle Wood productivity commission

props.synopsis: The head of Australia's Productivity Commission defends the economics profession, saying it will have valuable contributions to make to the big problems of the 21st century.

title.children: 'Some of the criticisms â¦ are well justified': Australia's Productivity Commission head defends economists

image.altText: Prescription medicines

props.synopsis: Hereâs what a review of assessment processes for medicines and vaccines suggested could be done to reduce PBS listing wait times.

title.children: New medicines could be PBS-listed in just four weeks if a 'visionary' proposal is adopted

image.altText: A man with short hair and a suit walks solemnly near a courthouse

props.synopsis: The MP has been awarded $140,000 after a Federal Court judge found a tweet posted by former One Nation NSW leader Mark Latham was defamatory.

title.children: Sydney MP Alex Greenwich awarded $140,000 after suing Mark Latham

image.altText: A man is silhouetted against a video screen with an Facebook logo as he poses with a smartphone

props.synopsis: Facebook has admitted that it scrapes the public photos, posts and other data of Australian adult users to train its AI models and provides no opt-out option, even though it allows people in the European Union to refuse consent.

title.children: Facebook admits to scraping every Australian adult user's public photos and posts to train AI, with no opt-out option

image.altText: Collage of photos Muriel McKay, the kidnapper (above) and (right) Anna and Rupert Murdoch, 1970

props.synopsis: Media mogul Rupert Murdoch loaned his Rolls Royce to his deputy. It led to a terrible case of mistaken identity that would change the course of two families' lives.

title.children: How the Murdoch family escaped a dark fate after case of mistaken identity

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The judge chairing an inquiry into an English hospital in which infant serial killer Lucy Letby worked tells a hearing anyone doubting the former nurse's guilt is causing her victims' families "enormous additional distress".

title.children: Lucy Letby was convicted of killing seven British babies. A judge has a warning for those who think she's innocent

image.altText: A line of people carry a huge Mexico flag outside a building at night.

props.synopsis: Mexico becomes the first country to allow voters to elect judges at all levels, after debate on the reform sparked mass demonstrations, diplomatic tensions and investor jitters.

title.children: Mexico becomes first country to approve popular election of judges

image.altText: A still from a video appearing to show former SA Liberal leader David Speirs leaning over a plate and snorting.

props.synopsis: David Speirs says he's taking time away from work to concentrate on his health days after a video â which appears to depict him snorting from a plate â emerges. He has previously strenuously denied wrongdoing, reportedly telling News Corp the video is a deepfake.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader takes medical leave two days after 'deepfake' snorting video emerges

image.altText: A man and woman smiling

props.synopsis: The Australian Paralympic team is being welcomed home at Sydney Airport after winning 63 medals at the Paris 2024 Paralympic Games.

title.children: Paralympians return to Sydney with 63 medals in tow

image.altText: An aerial view of the green river, with footpaths on either side.

props.synopsis: The state's environmental authority attributes the Pinheiros River's new green hue to an algae bloom, the result of severe drought that has significantly lowered water levels.

title.children: 'What the hell is happening?' SÃ£o Paulo river turns emerald green amid fires and drought
